title.raw: 《燕召公世家》 House of Yan Shaogong

sentences.zh: 召公奭與周同姓，姓姬氏。

translations.literal: The Duke of Shao Shi had the same surname as Zhou, the Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 周武王之滅紂，封召公於北燕。

translations.literal: When King Wu of Zhou extinguished Zhou, he enfeoffed the Duke of Shao at northern Yan.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu of Zhou overthrew the tyrant Zhou, he granted the Duke of Shao a fief in northern Yan.

sentences.zh: 其在成王時，召王為三公：自陜以西，召公主之；

translations.literal: In Cheng Wang time, Duke Shao became three dukes: from Shan west, Duke Shao governed it;
translations.idiomatic: In King Cheng's time, the Duke of Shao became one of the three dukes: west of Shan, the Duke of Shao governed it;

sentences.zh: 自陜以東，周公主之。

translations.literal: East of Shan, the Duke of Zhou governed it.
translations.idiomatic: East of the Shan pass, the Duke of Zhou administered the territory.

sentences.zh: 成王既幼，周公攝政，當國踐祚，召公疑之，作君奭。

translations.literal: King Cheng was already young, and the Duke of Zhou acted as regent, handling the state and ascending the throne. The Duke of Shao doubted this and composed "Jun Shi."
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng was still a child, so the Duke of Zhou served as regent, governing the state and occupying the throne. The Duke of Shao had doubts about this and wrote the "Jun Shi."

sentences.zh: 君奭不說周公。

translations.literal: "Jun Shi" was not pleased with the Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The "Jun Shi" expresses dissatisfaction with the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公乃稱「湯時有伊尹，假于皇天；

translations.literal: Zhou Gong then said 'Tang time had Yi Yin, assisted by August Heaven;
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou then said: 'In Tang's time there was Yi Yin, assisted by August Heaven;

sentences.zh: 在太戊時，則有若伊陟、臣扈，假于上帝，巫咸治王家；

translations.literal: In Tai Wu time, then had like Yi Zhi, Chen Hu, assisted by Shang Di, Wu Xian governed wang family;
translations.idiomatic: In Tai Wu's time, there were Yi Zhi and Chen Hu, assisted by Shang Di, and Wu Xian governed the royal family;

sentences.zh: 在祖乙時，則有若巫賢；

translations.literal: In Zu Yi time, then had like Wu Xian;
translations.idiomatic: In Zu Yi's time, there was Wu Xian;

sentences.zh: 在武丁時，則有若甘般：率維茲有陳，保乂有殷」。

translations.literal: In Wu Ding time, then had like Gan Pan: followed only this had arranged, protected righteousness had Yin.'
translations.idiomatic: In Wu Ding's time, there was Gan Pan: he followed and arranged this properly, protecting righteousness for Yin.'

sentences.zh: 於是召公乃說。

translations.literal: Therefore the Duke of Shao was then pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Only then was the Duke of Shao satisfied.

sentences.zh: 召公之治西方，甚得兆民和。

translations.literal: Duke Shao's governing western, very obtained myriad people harmony.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao's governance of the west very much obtained harmony with the myriad people.

sentences.zh: 召公巡行鄉邑，有棠樹，決獄政事其下，自侯伯至庶人各得其所，無失職者。

translations.literal: Duke Shao toured villages cities, had sweet棠 tree, decided cases administered affairs below it, from marquises counts to commoners each obtained their place, no lost position.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao toured the villages and cities. There was a crabapple tree under which he decided cases and administered affairs. From marquises and counts to commoners, each obtained their proper place, with none losing their position.

sentences.zh: 召公卒，而民人思召公之政，懷棠樹不敢伐，哥詠之，作甘棠之詩。

translations.literal: Duke Shao died, and people thought of Duke Shao's governance, cherished sweet棠 tree dared not cut, sang chanted it, made Sweet棠 poem.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao died, and the people thought of the Duke of Shao's governance. They cherished the crabapple tree and dared not cut it down. They sang and chanted about it, composing the 'Sweet Crabapple' poem.

sentences.zh: 自召公已下九世至惠侯。

translations.literal: From the Duke of Shao down nine generations to Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: Nine generations passed from the Duke of Shao to Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 燕惠侯當周厲王奔彘，共和之時。

translations.literal: Duke Hui of Yan was during the time when King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi, and the Gong He period.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 惠侯卒，子釐侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Hui died, and his son Duke Xi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 是歲，周宣王初即位。

translations.literal: In this year, King Xuan of Zhou first ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 釐侯二十一年，鄭桓公初封於鄭。

translations.literal: In Duke Xi's twenty-first year, Duke Huan of Zheng was initially enfeoffed at Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，釐侯卒，子頃侯立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Xi died, and his son Duke Qing ascended.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 頃侯二十年，周幽王淫亂，為犬戎所弒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, King Xuan of Zhou attacked Yan, Yan offered submission.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, King Xuan of Zhou campaigned against Yan, and Yan surrendered.

sentences.zh: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Yan attacked Yan, reached Yan city.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Yan invaded Yan and reached the city of Yan.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，頃侯卒，子哀侯立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Yan was extinguished by Marquis Wen of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Yan was destroyed by Duke Wen of Wei.

sentences.zh: 哀侯二年卒，子鄭侯立。

translations.literal: The Yan lineage was extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan lineage came to an end.

sentences.zh: 鄭侯三十六年卒，子繆侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Zheng died in his thirty-sixth year, and his son Duke Mu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 繆侯七年，而魯隱公元年也。

translations.literal: Duke Mu's seventh year was also Duke Yin's first year in Lu.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 十八年卒，子宣侯立。

translations.literal: He died in the eighteenth year, and his son Duke Xuan ascended.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 宣侯十三年卒，子桓侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan died in his thirteenth year, and his son Duke Huan ascended.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 桓侯七年卒，子莊公立。

translations.literal: Duke Huan died in his seventh year, and his son Duke Zhuang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 莊公十二年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhuang's twelfth year, Duke Huan of Qi began his hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the Zhou surname, belonging to the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 十六年，與宋、衛共伐周惠王，惠王出奔溫，立惠王弟穨為周王。

translations.literal: Wei Kang Shu, the Duke of Zhou's younger brother.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Kang Shu was the younger brother of the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十七年，鄭執燕仲父而內惠王于周。

translations.literal: When King Wu overthrew Zhou, he enfeoffed Kang Shu at Wei.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu overthrew the tyrant Zhou, he granted Kang Shu a fief at Wei.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，山戎來侵我，齊桓公救燕，遂北伐山戎而還。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, the Mountain Rong came to invade us, Duke Huan of Qi rescued Yan, then campaigned north against the Mountain Rong and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, the Shan Rong invaded our territory. Duke Huan of Qi came to Yan's rescue, then launched a northern campaign against the Shan Rong before returning.

sentences.zh: 燕君送齊桓公出境，桓公因割燕所至地予燕，使燕共貢天子，如成周時職；

translations.literal: Yan ruler sent Qi Huan Gong out border, Huan Gong therefore cut Yan what reached land gave Yan, made Yan together tribute Son of Heaven, like Cheng Zhou time duty;
translations.idiomatic: The Yan ruler sent Duke Huan of Qi out of the border. Duke Huan therefore cut off the land Yan had reached and gave it to Yan, making Yan together tribute the Son of Heaven, like the duty in Cheng Zhou times;

sentences.zh: 使燕復修召公之法。

translations.literal: Made Yan again repair Duke Shao's methods.
translations.idiomatic: He made Yan again repair the Duke of Shao's methods.

sentences.zh: 三十三年卒，子襄公立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year he died, his son Xiang Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year he passed away, and his son Xiang Gong ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 襄公二十六年，晉文公為踐土之會，稱伯。

translations.literal: Kang Shu's descendants were established as Wei Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu's descendants were appointed as Marquis of Wei.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，秦師敗于殽。

translations.literal: Kang Shu died, and his son Wen Bozong succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu passed away, and his son Wen Bozong inherited the marquisate.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: Wen Bozong died, and his son Wu succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Bozong died, and his son Wu inherited the position.

sentences.zh: 四十年，襄公卒，桓公立。

translations.literal: Wu died, and his son Chou succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Wu died, and his son Chou succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 桓公十六年卒，宣公立。

translations.literal: Chou died, and his son Kong succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Chou died, and his son Kong inherited the marquisate.

sentences.zh: 宣公十五年卒，昭公立。

translations.literal: Kong died, and his son Gao succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Kong died, and his son Gao succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 昭公十三年卒，武公立。

translations.literal: Gao died, and his son Hu succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Gao died, and his son Hu inherited the position.

sentences.zh: 是歲晉滅三郤大夫。

translations.literal: Hu died, and his son Si succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Hu died, and his son Si succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 武公十九年卒，文公立。

translations.literal: Si died, and his son Hei succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Si died, and his son Hei inherited the marquisate.

sentences.zh: 文公六年卒，懿公立。

translations.literal: Hei died, and his son Huan succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Hei died, and his son Huan inherited the marquisate.

sentences.zh: 懿公元年，齊崔杼弒其君莊公。

translations.literal: Huan died, and his son Li succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Huan died, and his son Li succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 四年卒，子惠公立。

translations.literal: Li died, and his son Xiang succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Li died, and his son Xiang inherited the position.

sentences.zh: 惠公元年，齊高止來奔。

translations.literal: Xiang died, and his son Wu succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang died, and his son Wu succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 六年，惠公多寵姬，公欲去諸大夫而立寵姬宋，大夫共誅姬宋，惠公懼，奔齊。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Duke Hui favored many concubines, the duke wished to remove the high officials and establish favored concubine Song, the high officials together executed Concubine Song, Duke Hui feared, fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Duke Hui doted on many concubines. The duke wanted to dismiss the chief ministers and install his favored concubine Song. The ministers joined forces to execute Concubine Song. Duke Hui, terrified, fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 四年，齊高偃如晉，請共伐燕，入其君。

translations.literal: Dai died, and his son Wen succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Dai died, and his son Wen succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 晉平公許，與齊伐燕，入惠公。

translations.literal: Wen died, and his son Zhuang succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Wen died, and his son Zhuang inherited the position.

sentences.zh: 惠公至燕而死。

translations.literal: Zhuang died, and his son Hui succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang died, and his son Hui succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 燕立悼公。

translations.literal: Yan established Duke Dao.
translations.idiomatic: Yan installed Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公七年卒，共公立。

translations.literal: Xiang died, and his son Dai succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang died, and his son Dai succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 共公五年卒，平公立。

translations.literal: Dai died, and his son Gong succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Dai died, and his son Gong inherited the position.

sentences.zh: 晉公室卑，六卿始彊大。

translations.literal: Gong died, and his son Xian succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Gong died, and his son Xian succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 平公十八年，吳王闔閭破楚入郢。

translations.literal: Xian died, and his son Mu succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Xian died, and his son Mu inherited the marquisate.

sentences.zh: 十九年卒，簡公立。

translations.literal: Mu died, and his son Zhang succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Mu died, and his son Zhang succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 簡公十二年卒，獻公立。

translations.literal: Zhang died, and his son Ai succeeded him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang died, and his son Ai inherited the position.

sentences.zh: 晉趙鞅圍范、中行於朝歌。

translations.literal: Jin's Zhao Yang surrounded Fan and Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge.
translations.idiomatic: Jin's Zhao Yang besieged the Fan and Zhonghang clans at Zhaoge.

sentences.zh: 獻公十二年，齊田常弒其君簡公。

translations.literal: In Duke Xian's twelfth year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated their lord Duke Jian.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's twelfth year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated their lord Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 十四年，孔子卒。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Kong Qiu died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Confucius died.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，獻公卒，孝公立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Xian died, and Duke Xiao ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Xian died and Duke Xiao ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 孝公十二年，韓、魏、趙滅知伯，分其地，三晉彊。

translations.literal: In Duke Xiao's twelfth year, Han, Wei, and Zhao extinguished Zhi Bo, divided his land, and the three Jin grew strong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao's second year, Qin sent troops to attack Xihe.

sentences.zh: 十五年，孝公卒，成公立。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Duke Xiao died, and Duke Cheng ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Third year, Duke Xiao died.

sentences.zh: 成公十六年卒，湣公立。

translations.literal: Duke Cheng died in his sixteenth year, and Duke Min ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui ascended, in the first year of Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 湣公三十一年卒，釐公立。

translations.literal: Duke Min died in his thirty-first year, and Duke Xi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui's second year, Jin attacked Qin and took less territory.

sentences.zh: 是歲，三晉列為諸侯。

translations.literal: In this year, the three Jin were ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui's third year, Duke Hui died.

sentences.zh: 釐公三十年，伐敗齊于林營。

translations.literal: In Duke Xi's thirtieth year, they attacked and defeated Qi at Lin Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's thirtieth year, they attacked and defeated Qi at Lin Ying.

sentences.zh: 釐公卒，桓公立。

translations.literal: Duke Xi died, and Duke Huan ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's second year, Qin attacked Jin.

sentences.zh: 桓公十一年卒，文公立。

translations.literal: Duke Huan died in his eleventh year, and Duke Wen ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's fourth year, Qin took Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦獻公卒。

translations.literal: In this year, Duke Xian of Qin died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's tenth year, Qin defeated Duke Huai at the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 秦益彊。

translations.literal: Qin grew increasingly strong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's twelfth year, Qin took Xiangling.

sentences.zh: 文公十九年，齊威王卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Wen's nineteenth year, King Wei of Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's thirteenth year, the first month, Duke Huai died in Qin.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，蘇秦始來見，說文公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Su Qin first came to see him and persuaded Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's son Duke Ling ascended.

sentences.zh: 文公予車馬金帛以至趙，趙肅侯用之。

translations.literal: Duke Wen gave him chariots, horses, gold, and silk to reach Zhao, and Marquis Su of Zhao used him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling's third year, the state of Guo attacked Qin, greatly defeating them at the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 因約六國，為從長。

translations.literal: He therefore allied the six states and became the alliance leader.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling's fifth year, the state of Guo attacked Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦惠王以其女為燕太子婦。

translations.literal: King Hui of Qin made his daughter the wife of Yan's crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling's sixth year, Duke Ling died.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，文公卒，太子立，是為易王。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Wen died, and the crown prince ascended as King Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Wen died, and the crown prince ascended as King Yi.

sentences.zh: 易王初立，齊宣王因燕喪伐我，取十城；

translations.literal: Yi Wang first ascended, Qi Xuan Wang took advantage Yan mourning attacked us, took ten cities;
translations.idiomatic: When King Yi first ascended, King Xuan of Qi took advantage of Yan's mourning to attack us and took ten cities;

sentences.zh: 蘇秦說齊，使復歸燕十城。

translations.literal: Su Qin persuaded Qi to return the ten cities to Yan again.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing's fourth year, Duke Jing died.

sentences.zh: 十年，燕君為王。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, the Yan lord became wang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing's younger brother Duke Ai ascended.

sentences.zh: 蘇秦與燕文公夫人私通，懼誅，乃說王使齊為反閒，欲以亂齊。

translations.literal: Su Qin had illicit relations with Duke Wen of Yan's wife. Fearing execution, he then persuaded the wang to have Qi become reverse spies, desiring to cause disorder in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai's second year, Qin defeated Duke Ai at the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 易王立十二年卒，子燕噲立。

translations.literal: King Yi ascended for twelve years and died, and his son Yan Kuai ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai's fourth year, Duke Ai died.

sentences.zh: 燕噲既立，齊人殺蘇秦。

translations.literal: After Yan Kuai ascended, the Qi people killed Su Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai's younger brother Duke Huai ascended.

sentences.zh: 蘇秦之在燕，與其相子之為婚，而蘇代與子之交。

translations.literal: When Su Qin was in Yan, he became a marriage alliance with his prime minister Zi Zhi, and Su Dai was friendly with Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's second year, Qin defeated Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 及蘇秦死，而齊宣王復用蘇代。

translations.literal: When Su Qin died, King Xuan of Qi again used Su Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's third year, Qin defeated Duke Huai at Xiao.

sentences.zh: 燕噲三年，與楚、三晉攻秦，不勝而還。

translations.literal: In Yan Kuai's third year, together with Chu and the three Jin, they attacked Qin but were not victorious and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's tenth year, Duke Huai died.

sentences.zh: 子之相燕，貴重，主斷。

translations.literal: Zi Zhi was prime minister of Yan, noble and heavy, making the main decisions.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's son Duke Wen ascended.

sentences.zh: 蘇代為齊使於燕，燕王問曰：「齊王奚如？」

translations.literal: Su Dai for Qi envoy to Yan, Yan Wang asked said: 'Qi Wang what like?'
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai was Qi's envoy to Yan. The Yan wang asked, saying: 'What is the Qi wang like?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「必不霸。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Must not hegemony.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'He must not achieve hegemony.'

sentences.zh: 燕王曰：「何也？」

translations.literal: Yan Wang said: 'Why?'
translations.idiomatic: The Yan wang said: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不信其臣。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Not trust his ministers.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'He does not trust his ministers.'

sentences.zh: 蘇代欲以激燕王以尊子之也。

translations.literal: Su Dai desired to stimulate the Yan wang to honor Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen's younger brother Duke Wu ascended.

sentences.zh: 於是燕王大信子之。

translations.literal: Therefore the Yan wang greatly trusted Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu's sixth year, attacked Qin, Qin defeated Duke Wu at the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 子之因遺蘇代百金，而聽其所使。

translations.literal: Zi Zhi therefore sent Su Dai a hundred jin of gold and listened to what he instructed.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu's thirteenth year, Qin defeated Duke Wu.

sentences.zh: 鹿毛壽謂燕王：「不如以國讓相子之。

translations.literal: Lu Mao Shou told Yan Wang: 'Not as good with state yield to prime minister Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Mao Shou told the Yan wang: 'It would be better to yield the state to Prime Minister Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 人之謂堯賢者，以其讓天下於許由，許由不受，有讓天下之名而實不失天下。

translations.literal: People call Yao worthy because he yielded the world to Xu You. Xu You did not accept it, so he had the name of yielding the world but actually did not lose the world.
translations.idiomatic: People call Yao worthy because he yielded the world to Xu You. Xu You did not accept it, so he had the name of yielding the world but actually did not lose the world.

sentences.zh: 今王以國讓於子之，子之必不敢受，是王與堯同行也。」

translations.literal: Now wang with state yield to Zi Zhi, Zi Zhi must dare not accept, this wang with Yao same conduct.'
translations.idiomatic: Now if the wang yields the state to Zi Zhi, Zi Zhi must not dare accept it. This means the wang will conduct himself the same as Yao.'

sentences.zh: 燕王因屬國於子之，子之大重。

translations.literal: The Yan wang therefore entrusted the state to Zi Zhi, and Zi Zhi became greatly heavy.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian's fifth year, Qin defeated Duke Xian.

translations.idiomatic: Zi Zhi faced south and performed the king's affairs, while Kuai, grown old, did not listen to government, but instead became a minister. All state affairs were decided by Zi Zhi.

translations.idiomatic: The crown prince thus gathered his partisans and amassed followers. General Shi Bei surrounded the ducal palace and attacked Zi Zhi, but failed.

sentences.zh: 將軍市被及百姓反攻太子平，將軍市被死，以徇。

translations.literal: General Shi Bei and the common people counter-attacked Crown Prince Ping. General Shi Bei died and was made an example.
translations.idiomatic: General Shi Bei and the people turned and attacked Crown Prince Ping. General Shi Bei died and was displayed as a warning.

sentences.zh: 因搆難數月，死者數萬，眾人恫恐，百姓離志。

translations.literal: Therefore they constructed difficulties for several months. Those who died numbered several ten thousand. The multitude was fearful and terrified, and the common people had separated intentions.
translations.idiomatic: The difficulties continued for several months, with tens of thousands dying. The people were terrified, and the populace lost heart.

sentences.zh: 孟軻謂齊王曰：「今伐燕，此文、武之時，不可失也。」

translations.literal: Meng Ke told Qi Wang said: 'Now attack Yan, this Wen, Wu time, cannot lose.'
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ke told the Qi wang, saying: 'Now to attack Yan—this is Wen and Wu's time. It cannot be lost.'

sentences.zh: 王因令章子將五都之兵，以因北地之眾以伐燕。

translations.literal: The wang therefore commanded Zhang Zi to lead the troops of five capitals, taking advantage of the northern lands' multitude to attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The king thus commanded Zhang Zi to lead the troops of the five commanderies, using the northern border forces to attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 士卒不戰，城門不閉，燕君噲死，齊大勝。

translations.literal: The soldiers did not fight, the city gates were not closed, Yan lord Kuai died, and Qi was greatly victorious.
translations.idiomatic: The soldiers did not fight, the city gates were not closed. Yan's Lord Kui died, and Qi achieved a great victory.

sentences.zh: 燕子之亡二年，而燕人共立太子平，是為燕昭王。

translations.literal: In the second year after Yan Zi Zhi perished, the Yan people together established Crown Prince Ping, who became King Zhao of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Zhi fled Yan for two years, and the people of Yan together established Crown Prince Ping. He became King Zhao of Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕昭王於破燕之後即位，卑身厚幣以招賢者。

translations.literal: King Zhao of Yan ascended after Yan was broken, lowered himself and offered thick gifts to attract worthy people.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Yan ascended the throne after Yan's defeat. He humbled himself and offered generous rewards to attract worthy men.

sentences.zh: 謂郭隗曰：「齊因孤之國亂而襲破燕，孤極知燕小力少，不足以報。

translations.literal: However truly obtain worthy scholars to share state, to wash away former wang shame, orphaned person's wish.

translations.idiomatic: Moreover, those more worthy than Wei, how would they be far a thousand li!'

translations.idiomatic: Thus King Zhao had a new palace built for Kui and treated him as his teacher.

sentences.zh: 樂毅自魏往，鄒衍自齊往，劇辛自趙往，士爭趨燕。

translations.literal: Yue Yi went from Wei, Zou Yan went from Qi, Ju Xin went from Zhao, and scholars contended to rush to Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Le Yi came from Wei, Zou Yan came from Qi, Ju Xin came from Zhao. Worthy men competed to go to Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕王噲死問孤，與百姓同甘苦。

translations.literal: When Yan Wang Kuai died, he asked the orphaned person, sharing sweet and bitter with the common people.
translations.idiomatic: When Yan Wang Kuai died, he asked about the orphaned and widowed, sharing sweet and bitter with the common people.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，燕國殷富，士卒樂軼輕戰，於是遂以樂毅為上將軍，與秦、楚、三晉合謀以伐齊。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, the Yan state was abundantly rich, the soldiers were happy and exceeded in light warfare. Therefore they made Yue Yi the chief general and united with Qin, Chu, and the three Jin to plot attacking Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, the Yan state was abundantly rich, the soldiers were happy and excelled in light warfare. Therefore they made Le Yi the chief general and united with Qin, Chu, and the three Jin to plot attacking Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊兵敗，湣王出亡於外。

translations.literal: The Qi troops were defeated, and King Min fled outside.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi troops were defeated, and King Min fled abroad.

sentences.zh: 燕兵獨追北，入至臨淄，盡取齊寶，燒其宮室宗廟。

translations.literal: The Yan troops alone pursued northward, entered to Lin Zi, completely took Qi's treasures, and burned their palaces and ancestral temples.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan troops alone pursued northward, entered Linzi, completely took Qi's treasures, and burned their palaces and ancestral temples.

sentences.zh: 齊城之不下者，獨唯聊、莒、即墨，其餘皆屬燕，六歲。

translations.idiomatic: The Qi king fled and ran to Ju, barely escaping with his life from the siege of Liao Cheng.

sentences.zh: 武成王七年，齊田單伐我，拔中陽。

translations.idiomatic: The Yan army besieged Linzi for three years, and the city was greatly impoverished.

translations.idiomatic: Ji Mo city was in great difficulty, the people were hungry and cold.

sentences.zh: 孝王元年，秦圍邯鄲者解去。

translations.idiomatic: Tian Dan led the people of Ji Mo to defend against the Yan army.

translations.idiomatic: He died in the third year, and his son the present wang Xi ascended.

translations.idiomatic: The Yan wang did not listen and personally led a flank army to follow it.

translations.idiomatic: Ju Xin originally resided in Zhao and was friendly with Pang Juan. Then he fled and went to Yan.

translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Crown Prince Dan was hostage in Qin, fled and returned to Yan.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，秦虜滅韓王安，置潁川郡。

translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Qin captured and extinguished King An of Han, established Yingchuan commandery.

translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Qin captured King Qian of Zhao, extinguished Zhao.

translations.idiomatic: Zhao crown prince Jia established himself as King Dai.

translations.idiomatic: Yan saw that Qin was about to extinguish the six states, Qin troops approached Yishui, calamity was about to reach Yan.

translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Dan secretly raised twenty stalwart men, sent Jing Ke to present the map of Du Kang lands to Qin, taking advantage to assassinate the Qin king.

sentences.zh: 秦王覺，殺軻，使將軍王翦擊燕。

translations.literal: The Qin wang became aware, killed Ke, and had General Wang Jian strike Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king became aware, killed Ke, sent General Wang Jian to attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，秦攻拔我薊，燕王亡，徙居遼東，斬丹以獻秦。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin attacked and captured our Ji. The Yan wang fled and moved to reside in Liao Dong. They beheaded Dan to offer to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin attacked and captured Ji, the Yan king fled, moved residence to Liaodong, executed Dan to present to Qin.

translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Qin extinguished Wei.

translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Qin captured Liaodong, captured Yan King Xi, finally extinguished Yan.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：召公奭可謂仁矣！

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Duke Shao Shi can be called humane!
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Duke Shao Shi can truly be called humane!

sentences.zh: 笆棠且思之，況其人乎？

translations.literal: Sweet棠 moreover thought of it, moreover its person?
translations.idiomatic: The people even think of the crabapple tree—what of the man himself?

sentences.zh: 燕（北）［外］迫蠻貉，內措齊、晉，崎嶇彊國之閒，最為弱小，幾滅者數矣。

translations.literal: Yan (north) [outer] pressed Man Mo, inner placed Qi, Jin, rugged strong states between, most weak small, nearly extinguished several times.
translations.idiomatic: Yan was pressed by barbarians and Mo on the outside, placed between Qi and Jin on the inside, rugged between strong states, and was the weakest and smallest. It nearly perished several times.

sentences.zh: 然社稷血食者八九百歲，於姬姓獨後亡，豈非召公之烈邪！

translations.literal: However altars sacrifices eight nine hundred years, among Ji surname alone last perished, how not Duke Shao's achievement!
translations.idiomatic: However, the altars and sacrifices lasted eight or nine hundred years. Among the Ji surname states, it alone perished last. How is this not Duke Shao's achievement!
